paper_abstract: This paper presents an algorithm for sampling and triangulating a generic C(2)-smooth surface Sigma subset of R(3) that is input with an implicit equation. The output triangulation is guaranteed to be homeomorphic to Sigma. We also prove that the triangulation has well-shaped triangles, large dihedral angles, and a small size. The only assumption we make is that the input surface representation is amenable to certain types of computations, namely, computations of the intersection points of a line and Sigma, computations of the critical points in a given direction, and computations of certain silhouette points.
paper_title: Sampling and meshing a surface with guaranteed topology and geometry
